boat.full_description:
Sold by Hunters as a kit to Mr Menhinick, she may not have been completed by him. Her sail number, 114, implies that she was one of the last of the Minstrel/Liberty 23 boats produced by Hunters. The hull was designed for the twin unstayed masts of the Liberty 22 and then modified for the Liberty 23. The Minstrel 23 used the same hull with a gunter rig.

'Boru' has not been spared some hard sailing and is probably best described as well used. Significant modifications include a conversion to a high peak gaff rig - longer hollow mast, larger tabernacle, gaff saddle etc.
boat.name: Boru

ownerships.note: After Mr Menhinick she was owned by Mr Kennet-Young and Mr Crowe. Invoices show Mr Kennet-Young was still building the boat in 1991. She was complete and sailing by the time Mr Sigley bought her, who sold 'Boru' to Martin Hampshire in 2012.

ownerships.note: please check this is not a namesake

boat.short_description: Sold by Hunters as a kit boat, she but seems to have taken a long time to complete. It's not clear which of the early owners actually launched her.
